Description: Blue glazed composition amulet: a vivid depiction of Nut as a sow with her young. Bristles stand up along its back and its curly tail is well rendered. Beneath its body, suckling at the teats, are seven piglets - four on one side, three on the other. A substantial ridged suspension loop is affixed to the top.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London 1994), p.35; J.H. Taylor and N.C. Strudwick, Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Treasures from The British Museum, Santa Ana and London 2005, pp. 120-1, pl. on p. 121.
Bibliographic references: Taylor & Strudwick 2005 / Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (p.120-121)
Exhibition history: 2005-2008, California, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Marion Whiteford Acworth JP
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Dr Joseph John Acworth
